Description: Tent hanging; rectangular, four panels hand sewn together along length. Plain weave; base cloth has natural-coloured cotton warp and weft with narrow blue-dyed warp stripes. Decorated on front in appliqué in red, light and mid blue, and natural- coloured cotton cloth hand sewn to base. Top of hanging has inscription in Arabic with further inscriptions in four panels below. Central circular section has foliate and floral motifs. Corners reinforced with yellow, blue and natural-coloured cotton cloth; hole for suspension in centre with brass ring surround. Lower edge of hanging hemmed by hand.
Condition: Fair; some appliqué cloth torn or damaged. Reinforced corners: rp top has lost brass ring; lp top is damaged.
Acquisition notes: Acquisition details unknown. Stored with African 'duplicate' material.
